com.octo.android.robospice
Class ContentManager

java.lang.Object
  com.octo.android.robospice.ContentManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ContentManager
extends Object
implements Runnable

The instances of this class allow to acces the ContentService.
They are tied to activities and obtain a local binding to the ContentService. When binding occurs, the ContentManager will send commadnds to the ContentService, to execute requests, clear cache, prevent listeners from beeing called and so on. Basically, all features of the ContentService are accessible from the ContentManager. It acts as an asynchronous proxy : every call to a ContentService method is asynchronous and will occur as soon as possible when the ContentManager successfully binds to the service.

Author:
jva, sni, mwa

Constructor Detail

ContentManager

public ContentManager(Class<? extends ContentService> contentServiceClass)
Creates a ContentManager. Typically this occurs in the construction of an Activity or Fragment. This method will check if the service to bind to has been properly declared in AndroidManifest.

Parameters:
contentServiceClass - the service class to bind to.
Method Detail

start

public void start(android.content.Context context)
Start the ContentManager. It will bind asynchronously to the ContentService.

Parameters:
context - a context that will be used to bind to the service. Typically, the Activity or Fragment that needs to interact with the ContentService.

isStarted

public boolean isStarted()
Method is synchronized with start(Context).

Returns:
whether or not the ContentManager is started.

run

public void run()
Specified by:
run in interface Runnable

shouldStop

public void shouldStop()
Stops the ContentManager. It will unbind from ContentService. All request listeners that had been registered to listen to ContentRequests sent from this ContentManager will be unregistered. None of them will be notified with the results of their ContentRequests. Unbinding will occur asynchronously.

shouldStopAndJoin

public void shouldStopAndJoin(long timeOut)
                       throws InterruptedException
This is mostly a testing method. Stops the ContentManager. It will unbind from ContentService. All request listeners that had been registered to listen to ContentRequests sent from this ContentManager will be unregistered. None of them will be notified with the results of their ContentRequests. Unbinding will occur syncrhonously : the method returns when all events have been unregistered and when main processing thread stops.

Throws:
InterruptedException

public <T> void execute(ContentRequest<T> request,
                        RequestListener<T> requestListener)
Execute a request, without using cache.

Parameters:
request - the request to execute.
requestListener - the listener to notify when the request will finish.

execute

public <T> void execute(ContentRequest<T> request,
                        String requestCacheKey,
                        long cacheDuration,
                        RequestListener<T> requestListener)
Execute a request, put the result in cache with key requestCacheKey during cacheDuration millisecond and register listeners to notify when request is finished.

Parameters:
request - the request to execute
requestCacheKey - the key used to store and retrieve the result of the request in the cache
cacheDuration - the time in millisecond to keep cache alive (see DurationInMillis)
requestListener - the listener to notify when the request will finish

execute

public <T> void execute(CachedContentRequest<T> cachedContentRequest,
                        RequestListener<T> requestListener)
Execute a request, put the result in cache and register listeners to notify when request is finished.

Parameters:
request - the request to execute. CachedContentRequest is a wrapper of ContentRequest that contains cache key and cache duration
requestListener - the listener to notify when the request will finish

dontNotifyRequestListenersForRequest

public void dontNotifyRequestListenersForRequest(ContentRequest<?> request)
Disable request listeners notifications for a specific request.
None of the listeners associated to this request will be called when request will finish.
This method will ask (asynchronously) to the ContentService to remove listeners if requests have already been sent to the ContentService if the request has already been sent to the service. Otherwise, it will just remove listeners before passing the request to the ContentService. Calling this method doesn't prevent request from beeing executed (and put in cache) but will remove request's listeners notification.

Parameters:
request - Request for which listeners are to unregistered.

dontNotifyRequestListenersForRequestInternal

protected void dontNotifyRequestListenersForRequestInternal(ContentRequest<?> request)
Internal method to remove requests. If request has not been passed to the ContentService yet, all listeners are unregistered locally before beeing passed to the service. Otherwise, it will asynchronously ask to the ContentService to remove the listeners of the request beeing processed.

Parameters:
request - Request for which listeners are to unregistered.

dontNotifyAnyRequestListeners

public void dontNotifyAnyRequestListeners()
Disable request listeners notifications for all requests.
Should be called in Activity.onStop()

dontNotifyAnyRequestListenersInternal

protected void dontNotifyAnyRequestListenersInternal()
Remove all listeners of requests. All requests that have not been yet passed to the service will see their of listeners cleaned. For all requests that have been passed to the service, we ask the service to remove their listeners.

public void cancel(ContentRequest<?> request)
Cancel a specific request

Parameters:
request - the request to cancel

public void cancelAllRequests()
Cancel all requests

removeDataFromCache

public <T> void removeDataFromCache(Class<T> clazz,
                                    Object cacheKey)
Remove some specific content from cache

Parameters:
clazz - the Type of data you want to remove from cache
cacheKey - the key of the object in cache

removeAllDataFromCache

public void removeAllDataFromCache()
Remove all data from cache. This will clear all data stored by the CacheManager of the ContentService.

setFailOnCacheError

public void setFailOnCacheError(boolean failOnCacheError)
Configure the behavior in case of error during reading/writing cache.
Specify wether an error on reading/writing cache must fail the process.

Parameters:
failOnCacheError - true if an error must fail the process

dumpState

public void dumpState()
Dumps request processor state.

                                throws InterruptedException
Wait for acquiring binding to ContentService.

Throws:
InterruptedException - in case the binding is interrupted.
